info.title: LET'S MOVE TOGETHER
info.subtitle: All together - for clean drinking water
info.headlineStrong: We use sport as a universal language to connect with people. Be it here with us in Europe or in the project areas worldwide. Sport brings people together and offers the opportunity to engage joyfully. With our Move4WATER platform, we want to raise awareness for the global drinking water situation on the one hand, and generate donations for our WASH (Water, Sanitation, Hygiene) projects on the other.
info.first: Move4WATER is YOUR sports campaign for drinking water projects worldwide. Whether on the bike, with your running buddy or during your yoga session - sport connects, is fun and, by the way, promotes your health!
info.second: Move4WATER is possible at any time, even in times of Covid19. Become a part of our Move4WATER community. Let's go!

we.title: THIS IS WHY WE DO THIS:
we.first: To give communities in Uganda access to clean drinking water & sanitation.
we.second: Because we enjoy sporting commitment - also and especially in times of pandemic.
we.third: Because clean water is a human right.
we.fourth: To get active together - no matter where you are and what your fitness level is.

you.title: THIS IS WHAT YOU DO
you.first: You are part of the Viva con Agua Family and connect with like-minded people in our Move4WATER community
you.second: You are doing something good for yourself and your body
you.third: You can compare your performance with others in our community

instructions.title: IT'S SO EASY:
instructions.first: Register here & connect your profile with the sports community app STRAVA
instructions.second: Donate an amount of your choice for drinking water projects & hygiene workshops
instructions.third: Activate friends and colleagues and share the action!
instructions.fourth: Hashtag #Move4WATER, feel free to link VcA (@Viva con Agua)
instructions.fifth: Track, if you like, your route and enter the result in your personal Ride4WATER profile
instructions.sixth: Share your run on your favourite channels

promo.title: GET READY FOR:
promo.first: Register here & feel free to connect your profile to the sports community app STRAVA
promo.second: Donate an amount of your choice for drinking water projects & hygiene workshops in Uganda
promo.third: Activate friends and colleagues and share the action!
promo.fourth: Hashtag #Ride4WATER, feel free to link VcA (@Viva con Agua)
promo.fifth: Ride: From 5-11 July 2021, - Whether alone, as team captain, with your colleagues or friends
promo.sixth: Track, if you like, your route and enter the result in your personal Ride4WATER profile
promo.seventh: Share your run on your favourite channels

info.title: LET'S RIDE TOGETHER
info.subtitle: All together - for clean drinking water in Uganda
info.headline: You, Viva con Agua and thousands of cyclists - for clean drinking water and the shared experience.
info.headlineStrong: After the Run is before the Ride: In March, more than 5,000 runners cycled around the world one and a half times. In the process, an incredible 110,000 Euros/CHF were raised for clean drinking water in South Africa. Now we're getting on the bike with you: whether on the way to work or on a bike tour with friends, whether on a mountain bike up the mountain or on a racing bike for a while - we'll ride together for clean drinking water for one week. Each on their own route, but virtually connected through the campaign. Take part in the #ride4water 2021!
info.first: The goal: to draw attention to the global drinking water situation and to raise funds for drinking water and hygiene projects in Uganda. With just 30 Euros/CHF we can give a school child access to drinking water, with 50 Euros/CHF we can finance a creative hygiene workshop.
info.second: So grab your bike gang or start your own team and invite friends and colleagues and cover as many kilometres as possible together
info.third: We're already in the saddle - are you at the start too?

first.title: Barmer (Health partner)
first.subtitle: Strong, when you need us
first.desc1: BARMER is there for the whole of life. Because everyone has their own recipe for life. We help people live healthier lives and get the best possible care when they're sick. We also provide support with preventive courses, health apps and health knowledge. In this, we are more than a health insurance company in the background. We are a coach, companion and strong partner who is always there for the insured. With transparency, a strong customer focus and little bureaucracy.
first.desc2: BARMER is one of the largest statutory health insurers in Germany and is committed to the health of millions of customers every day. Regular sport and the fun of exercise make a very important contribution to our health - which is why BARMER supports Viva con Agua's #run4water campaign.

third.title: Fräulein Triathlon (Community-Partner*in)
third.desc2: We are Miss Triathlon. We motivate women to be or become active in sports, to try triathlon, to participate in competitions or to set ambitious goals. We create protected spaces where women can exchange ideas, bring up important topics and completely redefine "Misses".
third.desc3: With us, ANY woman can be a Miss who wants to be and with her own self-image. As an independent woman (or girl) who pursues her sport with her own goals, but in a community or feels encouraged to start. Without pressure to perform, without doggedness. Everything can, but nothing must. That's how we roll!
third.desc4: Together with our community, we are thrilled to support Run4Water and the work of Viva con Agua this year. Let's collect water and kilometers together and painfully whisper a „My dear Miss“ as we cross the finish line.

0.header: WHAT DO I NEED TO KNOW ABOUT RUN4WATER?
0.body: #run4water is a virtual charity running event that will take place from 22nd to 28th March 2021. The run is organized by the non-profit association Viva con Agua de Sankt Pauli e.V., Viva con Agua Switzerland and Viva con Agua Austria with the aim of collecting more than EUR/CHF 50,000 in donations to support at least five schools in the Eastern Cape Province in South Africa. You can register until 28th March at 9 PM. The chosen route should be completed between 22nd and 28th March – it is up to the runner to decide when and where. In order to compare your results with those of other participants, it is required to enter the kilometers completed into your profile after the run. However, it is possible to participate in the run without this proof. Participation is free of charge, but donations are welcome.

1.header: HOW CAN I DONATE WITHIN THE FRAMEWORK OF THIS RUN?
1.body: Upon registration you have the opportunity to support the Viva con Agua project SA WINS (WINS = WASH in schools / WASH = water, sanitation, hygiene) with a voluntary donation. It’s your decision how much you want to donate – we are happy about every single donation. If you donate EUR/CHF 25, one student in the Eastern Cape Province will get permanent access to clean drinking water.

2.header: HOW DOES A TEAM REGISTRATION WORK?
2.body: You don't want to run alone? Visit the website move4water.org to register for #run4water with your team. You have two options: You can either build your own team and invite your fellow runners to join this team via an invitation link, or you can join an already existing team.

3.header: WHERE CAN I CHECK WHETHER MY TEAM IS ALREADY REGISTERED?
3.body: After you have registered at move4water.org, you can select the "Run4WATER" event. There you will find a tab called "Team" and have the possibility to either enter the name of your team into the search bar or to search for your team in the dropdown menu.

4.header: DO I GET A DONATION RECEIPT FOR MY DONATION?
4.body: Yes, if the amount is EUR/CHF 50 or higher. You will receive your digital donation receipt by e-mail at the beginning of next year. Please fill in your address details correctly.

5.header: CAN I SUPPORT THE VIVA CON AGUA PROJECT WITHOUT PARTICIPATING IN THE RUN?
5.body: Absolutely! As a sofa donor, you can make yourself comfortable on your couch during the running week and still do good. Just click on the sofa donation button and support Viva con Agua’s project and, in addition to that, motivate all runners with your donation.

6.header: HOW CAN COMPANIES ENGAGE IN THE RUN?
6.body: As a company, you can participate in the event as a "classic sponsor". If you want to do so, send an email to support@move4water.org and we will clarify the details with you as soon as possible. Moreover, the Run4WATER charity run is a great opportunity to get your colleagues enthusiastic about a team event and join the run as a team. For example, your company can match the kilometers run and therefore double the corresponding number of kilometers in EUR/CHF.

0.header: What do I need to know about the Ride4WATER?
0.body: The #ride4water is a virtual cycling event that will take place from 05-11 July 2021. The event is organised by the non-profit association Viva con Agua de Sankt Pauli e.V. and Viva con Agua Switzerland with the aim of raising 50,000 €/CHF in donations for our project 'One WASH Uganda'. Water, sanitation and hygiene projects will be implemented for schools and communities in the West Nile and Karamoja regions of Uganda. Registration starts on 7 July at 12 am. The chosen route should be completed between 5 and 11 July - each cyclist decides when and where. In order to compare your results with those of other participants, it is necessary to enter the kilometres completed in your profile after the ride. Participation in the event is also possible without this proof. Participation is basically free of charge, but a donation is welcome.

1.header: How can I donate to the event?
1.body: When registering, you have the opportunity to support Viva con Agua's 'One WASH Uganda' project with a voluntary donation. You decide how much you want to donate - we are happy about every single donation. With 30 Euros/CHF we can give a school child access to drinking water, with 50 Euros/CHF we can finance a creative hygiene workshop.

2.header: How does a team registration work?
2.body: Don't feel like doing it alone? On the site (move4water.org) there is also the possibility to register for the #ride4water with your team. You have two options: You can either create your own team and invite your fellow riders to join the team via an invitation link, or you can join an already existing team.

3.header: Where can I see if my team is already registered?
3.body: After you have registered at move4water.org, you can select the event 'Ride4WATER'. There you will find the tab 'Team' and the possibility to either enter the name of your team via the search bar or to search for your corresponding team in the dropdown bar.

4.header: Will I get a receipt for my donation?
4.body: Yes, from an amount of 50€ or CHF onwards. At the beginning of next year, your digital donation receipt will be sent to you by e-mail. Please fill in your address details correctly.

5.header: Can I support the One WASH Uganda project without riding myself?
5.body: Absolutely! As a sofa donor, you can make yourself comfortable on your couch during the event week and still do good. Click on the sofa donation button at the top right of move4water.org and support the Viva con Agua project and motivate all cyclists with your donation.

6.header: How can you get involved as a company in the event?
6.body: As a company, you have the option of participating in the event as a 'classic sponsor'. Please send an email to support@move4water.org and we will clarify everything with you as soon as possible. On the other hand, the Ride4WATER event is a welcome opportunity to inspire your colleagues for a team event and to start together as a team. For example, your company can match the kilometres ridden and donate the corresponding number of kilometres in €/CHF.

0.body: The donations will be used for the project 'One WASH Uganda'. Further information about the project can be found on the Viva con Agua homepage at:

1.header: WHAT WILL MY DONATION MAKE POSSIBLE?
1.body: Our goal is to provide access to clean drinking water & sanitation to schools and communities in Uganda.

2.body: If we collectively manage to raise €50,000/CHF, then we can build six wells and train appropriate water user committees in the respective communities.
